001package io.cyborgcode.roa.validator.functions;
002
003import java.util.Collection;
004import java.util.List;
005import java.util.Objects;
006
007/**
008 * Provides utility functions for validating assertions.
009 *
010 * <p>This class contains static methods that perform various validation operations,
011 * including equality checks, containment checks, numeric comparisons, string operations,
012 * and collection validations. These functions are used to implement different
013 * assertion types in the framework.
014 *
015 * @author Cyborg Code Syndicate üíçüë®üíª
016 */
017public final class AssertionFunctions {
018
019   private AssertionFunctions() {
020   }
021
022
023   /**
024    * Checks if the actual value is equal to the expected value.
025    */
026   public static boolean equals(Object actual, Object expected) {
027      return Objects.equals(actual, expected);
028   }
029
030   /**
031    * Checks if the actual value is not equal to the expected value.
032    */
033   public static boolean notEquals(Object actual, Object expected) {
034      return !Objects.equals(actual, expected);
035   }
036
037   /**
038    * Checks if the actual value contains the expected value as a substring.
039    */
040   public static boolean contains(Object actual, Object expected) {
041      if (actual == null || expected == null) {
042         return false;
043      }
044      return actual.toString().contains(expected.toString());
045   }
046
047   /**
048    * Checks if the actual value is not null.
049    */
050   public static boolean notNull(Object actual, Object expected) {
051      boolean condition = Objects.nonNull(actual);
052      return expected instanceof Boolean e && condition == e;
053   }
054
055   /**
056    * Checks if the actual value is null.
057    */
058   public static boolean isNull(Object actual, Object expected) {
059      boolean condition = Objects.isNull(actual);
060      return expected instanceof Boolean e && condition == e;
061   }
062
063   /**
064    * Checks if all elements in a collection are not null.
065    */
066   public static boolean allNotNull(Object actual, Object expected) {
067      if (!isCollection(actual)) {
068         return false;
069      }
070      boolean condition = ((Collection<?>) actual).stream().allMatch(Objects::nonNull);
071      return expected instanceof Boolean exp && condition == exp;
072   }
073
074   /**
075    * Checks if all elements in a collection are null.
076    */
077   public static boolean allNull(Object actual, Object expected) {
078      if (!isCollection(actual)) {
079         return false;
080      }
081      boolean condition = ((Collection<?>) actual).stream().allMatch(Objects::isNull);
082      return expected instanceof Boolean exp && condition == exp;
083   }
084
085   /**
086    * Checks if the actual numeric value is greater than the expected numeric value.
087    */
088   public static boolean greaterThan(Object actual, Object expected) {
089      if (!isNumber(actual) || !isNumber(expected)) {
090         throw new IllegalArgumentException("Both actual and expected must be numbers.");
091      }
092      return ((Number) actual).doubleValue() > ((Number) expected).doubleValue();
093   }
094
095   /**
096    * Checks if the actual numeric value is less than the expected numeric value.
097    */
098   public static boolean lessThan(Object actual, Object expected) {
099      if (!isNumber(actual) || !isNumber(expected)) {
100         throw new IllegalArgumentException("Both actual and expected must be numbers.");
101      }
102      return ((Number) actual).doubleValue() < ((Number) expected).doubleValue();
103   }
104
105   /**
106    * Checks if all elements in the expected collection exist in the actual collection.
107    */
108   public static boolean containsAll(Object actual, Object expected) {
109      if (!isCollection(actual) || !isCollection(expected)) {
110         return false;
111      }
112      return ((Collection<?>) actual).containsAll((Collection<?>) expected);
113   }
114
115   /**
116    * Checks if any element in the expected collection exists in the actual collection.
117    */
118   public static boolean containsAny(Object actual, Object expected) {
119      if (!isCollection(actual) || !isCollection(expected)) {
120         return false;
121      }
122      Collection<?> actualCollection = (Collection<?>) actual;
123      Collection<?> expectedCollection = (Collection<?>) expected;
124      return expectedCollection.stream().anyMatch(actualCollection::contains);
125   }
126
127   /**
128    * Checks if the actual string starts with the expected string.
129    */
130   public static boolean startsWith(Object actual, Object expected) {
131      if (actual == null || expected == null) {
132         return false;
133      }
134      return actual.toString().startsWith(expected.toString());
135   }
136
137   /**
138    * Checks if the actual string ends with the expected string.
139    */
140   public static boolean endsWith(Object actual, Object expected) {
141      if (actual == null || expected == null) {
142         return false;
143      }
144      return actual.toString().endsWith(expected.toString());
145   }
146
147   /**
148    * Checks if the actual value has the expected length.
149    */
150   public static boolean length(Object actual, Object expected) {
151      if (!(expected instanceof Number)) {
152         throw new IllegalArgumentException("Expected value must be a number.");
153      }
154      int expectedLength = ((Number) expected).intValue();
155
156      if (actual instanceof String str) {
157         return str.length() == expectedLength;
158      } else if (actual instanceof Collection<?> coll) {
159         return coll.size() == expectedLength;
160      }
161      return false;
162   }
163
164   /**
165    * Checks if the actual string matches the expected regex pattern.
166    */
167   public static boolean matchesRegex(Object actual, Object expected) {
168      if (actual == null || expected == null) {
169         return false;
170      }
171      if (!(expected instanceof String)) {
172         throw new IllegalArgumentException("Expected value must be a valid regex string.");
173      }
174      return actual.toString().matches(expected.toString());
175   }
176
177   /**
178    * Checks if the actual collection is empty.
179    */
180   public static boolean isEmpty(Object actual, Object expected) {
181      boolean condition = (actual instanceof Collection) && ((Collection<?>) actual).isEmpty();
182      return expected instanceof Boolean exp && condition == exp;
183   }
184
185   /**
186    * Checks if the actual collection is not empty.
187    */
188   public static boolean isNotEmpty(Object actual, Object expected) {
189      boolean condition = (actual instanceof Collection) && !((Collection<?>) actual).isEmpty();
190      return expected instanceof Boolean exp && condition == exp;
191   }
192
193   /**
194    * Checks if the actual numeric value falls within a given range.
195    */
196   public static boolean between(Object actual, Object expected) {
197      if (!isNumber(actual) || !(expected instanceof List<?>)) {
198         throw new IllegalArgumentException("Expected must be a list with two numeric values.");
199      }
200      List<?> range = (List<?>) expected;
201      if (range.size() != 2 || !(range.get(0) instanceof Number) || !(range.get(1) instanceof Number)) {
202         throw new IllegalArgumentException("Expected list must contain exactly two numeric values.");
203      }
204
205      double min = ((Number) range.get(0)).doubleValue();
206      double max = ((Number) range.get(1)).doubleValue();
207      double value = ((Number) actual).doubleValue();
208
209      return value >= min && value <= max;
210   }
211
212   /**
213    * Checks if the actual string is equal to the expected string, ignoring case.
214    */
215   public static boolean equalsIgnoreCase(Object actual, Object expected) {
216      if (actual == null || expected == null) {
217         return false;
218      }
219      return actual.toString().equalsIgnoreCase(expected.toString());
220   }
221
222   /**
223    * Checks if the given object is a collection.
224    */
225   private static boolean isCollection(Object obj) {
226      return obj instanceof Collection;
227   }
228
229   /**
230    * Checks if the given object is a number.
231    */
232   private static boolean isNumber(Object obj) {
233      return obj instanceof Number;
234   }
235
236}
